intro: Asyneuma debile, commonly known as the weak morning glory, is a small, herbaceous annual plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with distinctive funnel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-30 centimeters, with slender stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue to white, with five petals and a tubular corolla. Asyneuma debile is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, and it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
